text:
greetings.

 freebsd 4.5-release
 apache/1.3.27
 php/4.2.1
 mod_perl/1.27
 mod_ssl/2.8.11
 openssl/0.9.6e

my /var partition filled up this morning with loads of identical lines
in the main/default error_log file for httpd (i have a few virtual
websites on this machine, one is a phpbb site and another is imp).  the
error_log file grew to about 16.8gb.

the lines that repeated for 87,615,977 times are :

 warning: httpdrecursive call
 in free():httpd warning:  in free():recursive call

(not sure which is first)

also seen in the error_log file approximately 36,359,599 times :

 httpd in free(): warning: chunk is already free

no idea on how to recreate, please advise.
creator: kawaja@ece.ufl.edu
trawick@apache.org
text:
I don't know how to recreate either.  If you can recreate with pure Apache httpd
and no third party modules, we'd like to know.

For now we assume it is a problem in the patches to Apache or the 3rd party modules.
